title: The Alchemist
description: A journey of self-discovery and adventure across the desert.
author: Paulo Coelho

description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society under constant surveillance.
author: George Orwell

description: A gripping novel about racial injustice in the Deep South.
author: Harper Lee

description: A classic novel about manners, marriage, and misunderstandings.
author: Jane Austen

title: The Hobbit
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on an epic adventure to reclaim a lost kingdom.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

title: Fahrenheit 451
description: A dystopian novel about a future where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn them.
author: Ray Bradbury

title: Moby-Dick
description: The saga of Captain Ahab’s obsessive quest to kill a giant white whale.
author: Herman Melville

title: War and Peace
description: A vast epic about Napoleon’s invasion of Russia and its impact on society.
author: Leo Tolstoy

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: The story of teenage Holden Caulfield’s struggles with identity and belonging.
author: J.D. Salinger

title: Jane Eyre
description: A young woman’s journey of growth, love, and moral integrity.
author: Charlotte Brontë

title: The Lord of the Rings
description: An epic fantasy adventure in Middle-earth to destroy a powerful ring.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

title: The Grapes of Wrath
description: A family’s struggle during the Great Depression in America.
author: John Steinbeck

title: Animal Farm
description: An allegorical novella about the rise of totalitarianism.
author: George Orwell

title: Great Expectations
description: The growth and personal development of an orphan named Pip.
author: Charles Dickens

title: Crime and Punishment
description: A psychological exploration of guilt and redemption.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

title: The Odyssey
description: The epic journey of Odysseus returning home after the Trojan War.
author: Homer

title: Dracula
description: A Gothic horror story about the vampire Count Dracula.
author: Bram Stoker

title: Frankenstein
description: A scientist’s creation of a living being and its tragic consequences.
author: Mary Shelley

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
description: A man sells his soul to stay forever young.
author: Oscar Wilde

title: Les Misérables
description: A sprawling tale of justice, love, and redemption in 19th-century France.
author: Victor Hugo
